alert.note: Alert for Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 9:40AM EST until February 04 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central West Virginia, northern West Virginia and southern West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Calhoun, Gilmer, Jackson and Roane. In northern West Virginia, Lewis and Wirt. In southern West Virginia, Kanawha. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain has fallen. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spencer, Glenville, Grantsville, Arnoldsburg, Amma, Cedar Creek State Park, Sandyville, Reedy, Sand Fork, Mount Zion, Millstone, Orma, Annamoriah, Chloe, Tariff, Creston, Stumptown, Nicut, Big Springs and Looneyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Lewis; Roane; Wirt
